problem.markdown:
Lyme Lake has a volume of 100,000 litres of water and is fed by a river that delivers approximately 10,000 litres of water per day. The lake is drained by another river that removes 10,000 litres of water per day.
>>What is the mean residence time (MRT), in days, of a molecule of water in Lyme Lake?<< = 10
[explanation] The mean residence time (MRT) is the average time a typical molecule remains in a system. In order to determine the MRT use the equation: volume of pool / flux in or flux out. Therefore, in this problem if the volume is 100,000 litres and the flux is 10,000 litres/day, then the MRT = 100,000/10,000 = 10 days. [explanation]
